info.title: Alchemy Ink JSON-RPC Specification
info.description: A specification of the standard JSON-RPC methods for Ink.

methods.name: eth_blockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of the most recent block.

result.name: Block number
result.description: The block number of the most recently mined block as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_call
methods.summary: Executes a new message call immediately without creating a transaction on the blockchain.

params.name: Transaction
params.description: The transaction call object containing the details of the message call.

schema.title: Transaction object generic to all types

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

maxFeePerBlobGas.title: max fee per blob gas
maxFeePerBlobGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay for blob gas in wei

blobVersionedHashes.title: blobVersionedHashes
blobVersionedHashes.description: List of versioned blob hashes associated with the transaction's EIP-4844 data blobs.

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

params.name: Block
params.description: The block number, tag, or hash at which to execute the call. Defaults to `'latest'` if not provided.

schema.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

anyOf.title: Block tag
anyOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

result.name: Return data
result.description: The return value of the executed contract function, encoded as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_chainId
methods.summary: Returns the chain ID of the current network as a hexadecimal string.

result.name: Chain ID
result.description: The chain ID of the current network in hexadecimal format.

methods.name: eth_estimateGas
methods.summary: Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete.

params.name: Transaction
params.description: The transaction object for which to estimate gas usage.

schema.title: Transaction object generic to all types

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

maxFeePerBlobGas.title: max fee per blob gas
maxFeePerBlobGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay for blob gas in wei

blobVersionedHashes.title: blobVersionedHashes
blobVersionedHashes.description: List of versioned blob hashes associated with the transaction's EIP-4844 data blobs.

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

params.name: Block
params.description: The block number or tag at which to estimate gas usage. Defaults to `'latest'` if not provided.

oneOf.title: Block tag
oneOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

result.name: Gas used
result.description: The estimated amount of gas required for the transaction, as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_gasPrice
methods.summary: Returns the current price per gas in wei.

result.name: Gas price
result.description: The current gas price in wei, as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_getBalance
methods.summary: Returns the balance of the account of a given address.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the account to query the balance for.

params.name: Block
params.description: The block number, tag, or hash at which to retrieve the balance. Can be a block number, 'latest', 'earliest', 'pending', or a block hash.

schema.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

anyOf.title: Block tag
anyOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

result.name: Balance
result.description: The balance of the account in wei, encoded as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_getBlockByHash
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by its hash.

params.name: Block hash
params.description: The hash of the block to retrieve.

params.name: Hydrated transactions
params.description: If true, returns full transaction objects; if false, returns only transaction hashes.

result.name: Block information
result.description: The block object containing various properties of the block.

maxFeePerBlobGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay for blob gas in wei

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

params.name: Block hash
params.description: The hash of the block.

result.name: Transaction count
result.description: The number of transactions in the block as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.

params.name: Block number or tag
params.description: The block number or special tags like 'latest', 'earliest', or 'pending'.

oneOf.title: Block tag
oneOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

result.name: Transaction count
result.description: The number of transactions in the block as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_getCode
methods.summary: Returns the code at a given address.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the contract to get code from.

params.name: Block
params.description: The block number, tag, or hash at which to retrieve the code.

schema.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

anyOf.title: Block tag
anyOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

result.name: Bytecode
result.description: The code from the specified address, as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_getLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching the specified filter.

params.name: Filter
params.description: The filter options object to specify the criteria for logs retrieval.

result.name: Log objects
result.description: An array of log objects matching the filter criteria.

methods.name: eth_getProof
methods.summary: Returns the Merkle proof for a given account and optionally some storage keys.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the account to generate the proof for.

params.name: StorageKeys
params.description: An array of storage keys (slots) to generate proofs for.

params.name: Block
params.description: The block number, tag, or hash at which to generate the proof.

schema.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

anyOf.title: Block tag
anyOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

result.name: Account proof
result.description: An object containing the account proof and storage proofs.

methods.name: eth_getStorageAt
methods.summary: Returns the value from a storage position at a given address.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the contract to read storage from.

params.name: Storage slot
params.description: The index position of the storage slot to retrieve, as a hexadecimal string.

params.name: Block
params.description: The block number, tag, or hash at which to retrieve the storage value.

schema.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

anyOf.title: Block tag
anyOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

result.name: Value
result.description: The value stored at the given storage slot, encoded as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a transaction by block hash and transaction index position.

params.name: Block hash
params.description: The hash of the block containing the transaction.

params.name: Transaction index
params.description: The index position of the transaction in the block's transaction list, as a hexadecimal string.

result.name: Transaction information
result.description: The transaction object containing various properties of the transaction.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionCount
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions sent from an address.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the account to get the transaction count for.

params.name: Block
params.description: The block number, tag, or hash at which to retrieve the transaction count.

schema.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

anyOf.title: Block tag
anyOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

result.name: Transaction count
result.description: The number of transactions sent from the address, as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionReceipt
methods.summary: Returns the receipt of a transaction by transaction hash.

params.name: Transaction hash
params.description: The hash of the transaction for which to get the receipt.

result.name: Receipt information
result.description: The transaction receipt object containing various properties of the transaction receipt.

to.title: to
to.description: Address of the receiver or null in a contract creation transaction.

cumulativeGasUsed.title: cumulative gas used
cumulativeGasUsed.description: The sum of gas used by this transaction and all preceding transactions in the same block.

gasUsed.title: gas used
gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used for this specific transaction alone.

blobGasUsed.title: blob gas used
blobGasUsed.description: The amount of blob gas used for this specific transaction. Only specified for blob transactions as defined by EIP-4844.

contractAddress.title: contract address
contractAddress.description: The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null.

root.title: state root
root.description: The post-transaction state root. Only specified for transactions included before the Byzantium upgrade.

status.title: status
status.description: Either 1 (success) or 0 (failure). Only specified for transactions included after the Byzantium upgrade.

effectiveGasPrice.title: effective gas price
effectiveGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account. Before EIP-1559, this is equal to the transaction's gas price. After, it is equal to baseFeePerGas + min(maxFeePerGas - baseFeePerGas, maxPriorityFeePerGas).

blobGasPrice.title: blob gas price
blobGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account for blob gas. Only specified for blob transactions as defined by EIP-4844.

methods.name: eth_sendRawTransaction
methods.summary: Submits a raw transaction to the network.
methods.description:
Submits a raw transaction (serialized and signed) for broadcasting to the network. The transaction data should be encoded as a hexadecimal string starting with `0x`. You can create and sign a transaction externally using libraries like [web3.js](https://web3js.readthedocs.io/) or [ethers.js](https://docs.ethers.org/). 

**Note:** For [EIP-4844](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4844) transactions, the raw form must be in the network format, which includes blobs, KZG commitments, and KZG proofs.

params.name: Transaction
params.description: The raw transaction data to submit, encoded as a hexadecimal string.

result.name: Transaction hash
result.description: The hash of the submitted transaction, as a hexadecimal string.

methods.name: eth_syncing
methods.summary: Returns an object with data about the sync status or `false` if not syncing.

result.name: Syncing status
result.description: An object with synchronization status data when syncing, or `false` when not syncing.

oneOf.title: Not syncing
oneOf.description: Should always return false if not syncing.

methods.name: net_version
methods.summary: Returns the network ID that the client is connected to.

result.name: Network ID
result.description: The network ID as a string. Common IDs are `"1"` for mainnet, `"3"` for Ropsten, etc.

methods.name: web3_clientVersion
methods.summary: Returns the current client version.

result.name: Client Version
result.description: A string identifying the client software name, version, and platform.

methods.name: web3_sha3
methods.summary: Returns Keccak-256 (not the standardized SHA3-256) hash of the given data.

params.name: Data
params.description: The data to hash, encoded as a hexadecimal string.

result.name: Hash
result.description: The Keccak-256 hash of the input data, as a hexadecimal string.
